required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Adenosine on Cranial Hemodynamic, Headache and Migraine Induction Properties.
clinical_study.official_title: To Investigate the Headache Induction and the Cerebral Hemodynamic Changes After Infusion of Adenosine in Healthy Volunteers and Migraine Patient

brief_summary.textblock:
Adenosine is a nucleoside that plays a role in both vascular and nociceptive systems, and it has been proposed that adenosine may cause headache in particularly sensitive subjects.
Thus, considerable evidence implied that adenosine plays a role in migraine pathophysiology, it is still unknown if intravenous adenosine infusion provokes migraine attacks in healthy subject or in migraine patients. Furthermore, adenosine's effects on the cerebral hemodynamic remains unknown.
This study aims to clarify a possible coherence between adenosine and headache/migraine. In general, the study will contribute to a greater understanding of migraine pathogenesis and possibly lead to development of specific migraine treatment.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and change of migraine attack
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 minutes) and after infusion (+12 hours) of adenosine compared with before and after infusion of saline
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence and of migraine according to international criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 minutes) and after infusion (+12 hours) of adenosine compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Change on velocity of media cerebri artery.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 minutes) and after infusion (+12 hours) of adenosine compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of headache measured by numerical rating scale (NRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of diameter of the artery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 minutes) and after infusion (+12 hours) of adenosine compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Change of diameter of superficial temporal artery and radial artery. The diameter will be measured by millimeter (mm).

intervention.description: To investigate the role of adenosine on cerebral hemodynamic and headache in healthy volunteers and migraine patients
To investigate the role of saline on cerebral hemodynamic and headache in healthy volunteers and migraine patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Migraine patients without aura who fulfill criteria in the international classification of headaches. This does not apply to healthy volunteers.
- 18-60 years.
- 50-90 kg.
- Women of childbearing potential must use adequate contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Headache less than 48 hours before the tests start
- All primary headaches, except migraine without aura for migraine patients, according to international classification of headache
- Daily consumption of drugs of any kind other than oral contraceptives
- Pregnant or nursing women.
- Cardiovascular disease of any kind, including cerebrovascular diseases.
